### Title: 
Challenge-Based Solicitation (CBS) 
### Reference Number:98458 
### Solicitation Number ES008 
### Solicitation Date:August 19, 2022 
### Tender Closing Date:September 23,2022 3:00 PM EST 
### Description:
**INTENT**

The National Capital Commission (NCC) invites local and national bid submissions to develop a Cloud-based platform with Smart Contract-based Automated negotiation capabilities for its current Agreement System.

**Objective**

This solicitation involves six stages:

1. Solicitation: Proposals and evaluation
2. Contract Award: Up to three (3) prototypes (~ 3+2+2 option years contract duration)
3. Webinar with selected contractors
4. Prototype Design and Development
5. Prototype Testing and Evaluation
6. Implementation (optional)

**Procurement Requirements:**

A Challange-based Solicitation (CBS):

1. Address all Mandatory and Technical requirements.

2. Submit and deliver prototypes for evaluation.
 
**Evaluation Criteria:**

Evaluation will be based on the following criteria:

- Technical Merit
- Price

The evaluation framework will be detailed in the attached solicitation document.

**Business and Administrative Requirements:**

The award of contract for the delivery of Agreement system`s solutions will be based on the submitted prototypes and subsequent evaluation.

**Conference and review sessions with the selected bidder**

There are no scheduled review sessions behind proposed bidders.

**Return bid deadline **

National Capital Commission 
Procurement Services 
bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca 
Reference ES008.

**Language **

Submission and supporting documents may be submitted in either English or French.

**Technical Requirements**

(i) Understand the agreements in place and familiarize themselves with them.

(ii) Write smart contract content — as system descriptions.
A Prototype specification- as part of a Service called Agreement service will be described in the technical requirements section of the bid.

**Bid Requirements:**

Submission must be made electronically (no mail) sent to bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca. The submission must include all pages of the proposed system starting from the system description.

**Description :**
The tender consists of a Feedforward process – each submission sets off another submission based on linked submissions.

 Any and all bid questions or submissions should only be sent electronically via email only to this office.

Consider the Offical Government Electronic Tendering Service website
